basics.name: Joshua Sylvester
basics.label: Cyber Security Researcher
basics.summary: A motivated and hardworking researcher with a passion for artificial intelligence and cyber security. Experienced in reinforcement learning, cyber defence, and machine learning applications. Committed to advancing autonomous cyber defence through scalable reinforcement learning methods and reducing the sim-to-real gap in research.

work.summary: Researching reinforcement learning for autonomous cyber defence. Focused on removing assumptions from simulators and adapting PPO algorithms for scalable, task-based reinforcement learning.
highlights: Developed new PPO variants for scalable multi-task learning.
Improved sim-to-real transfer in cyber defence environments.

work.name: University of Kent
work.summary: Lead instructor during practical sessions, responsible for grading, feedback, academic support, and facilitating student engagement.
highlights: Prepared instructional materials and guided student projects.

work.name: Orange Cyberdefense
work.summary: Applied machine learning to cybersecurity problems such as text classification and named-entity recognition. Automated data labelling and built containerised solutions for production.
highlights: Developed web scrapers and automated labelling pipelines.
Produced monthly and final-year security landscape reports.

work.name: Tesco
work.summary: Managed customer orders, ensured order accuracy, and maintained stock rotation and safety compliance.
highlights: Trained new staff members in operational procedures.

work.name: Othello’s Restaurant
work.summary: Provided customer service in a fast-paced environment, handled transactions, and ensured hygiene standards.
highlights: Developed strong teamwork and customer communication skills.

education.summary: Working on autonomous cyber defence and reinforcement learning, with research published at IEEE CSR and collaboration with Dstl ARCD on 'Reward shaping for network defence based on reinforcement learning.'
Awarded for outstanding overall performance and best final-year project in the School of Computing.

projects.name: Reward Shaping for Network Defence
projects.summary: Collaborative research project with Dstl ARCD exploring reinforcement learning techniques for autonomous cyber defence agents.
highlights: Applied reinforcement learning to network defence tasks.
